author: A D
text:
Four people, including a temple volunteer, drowned in a stampede on Monday when they were taking a dip at Ayyankula Theertham as part of Mahodaya Punyakala Theerthavaari that comes once in several years.

The Utsava Murthi of Sri Arunachaleswarar Temple was taken to the pond around 6.30 a.m. and thousands of devotees rushed to take a dip. The handful of police personnel at the spot could do nothing to prevent them. The crowd barged into the pond, and in the melee some fell down and the crowd trampled them.

The priests were rescued. A devotee who was also rescued died later.

Sources in the fire and rescue services said the temple administration had not asked for assistance as a precautionary measure.
title: Four drown in stampede in T.N. temple pond
